channel.title: Making myself an admin
channel.description: ok. i have berkyscape client and server. i go to bulby/io/login changed the name. compiled. go to login and still not an admin. what the hell?

item.title: Making myself an admin
item.dc:creator: @YoungDLB YoungDLB
item.description:
@YoungDLB wrote:

well i go to my characters.dat file to change the rights i’ve tried to use 2 and 3. but then i go back to my character file and it’s back at 0. hmmm[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 04, 2009, 06:37:24 pm[/size][hr]i think it was just your luck. cuz in the login.java its the first one and no spaces. so[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 04, 2009, 06:55:32 pm[/size][hr]figured it out guys! thanks for the help! appreciate it

Read full topic

item.title: Making myself an admin
item.dc:creator: @Monkey_wacko Monkey wacko
item.description:
@Monkey_wacko wrote:

Should be inside login.java.

I have messed around with this source, make sure your name has no “spaces” or “_ things”… Make your name the first one on the list. Because when i tried it with spaces in my name and it didn’t work, Once i took the spaces out it worked.

Could have just been my luck, just mess around with it…

Read full topic

item.title: Making myself an admin
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

OwnageDBOW:

Go to your character files, go to your account name. Then at Rights = 0 Change the 0 to a 3. Also you must be logged out, and you don’t need to compile if it’s a character file issue.

This is for a 508.

What did you set the rights to?

Read full topic

item.description:
@OwnageDBOW wrote:

Go to your character files, go to your account name. Then at Rights = 0 Change the 0 to a 3. Also you must be logged out, and you don’t need to compile if it’s a character file issue.
